page.title: 07BIRDLIFE
page.content: The area is rich in birdlife on moorland, farmland and woodland as well as near numerous small streams. Blackbirds, robins & thrushes are seen in profusion, as are flocks of yellow hammers, chaffinches, sparrows & starlings. Many species of the tit family, blue, great, long tailed & blackcap, breed happily. On farmland & moorland, pheasants & partridge, red grouse & curlew can be seen with a lesser number of woodcock. Redwings & fieldfares are winter visitors & in summer swallows, swifts & cuckoos come. Pigeons & collared doves breed in profusion in the woods together with other members of the crow family.By streams the occasional kingfisher & heron may be seen. Kestrels hunt by day & owls by night. Magpies are increasing. A snow bunting was sighted in 1979.
